column4: I want to find whether my home directory got encrypted or not..How to check this???
check /etc/fstab
fstab???
yes it's a file. you can look at it with any texteditor
What result i will get if i am encrypted??
to be honest i don't know. but it should be in there.
your homedir that is
try removing the config files
how??
try rm -R ~/.gconf/apps/nautilus while nautilus is closed
What will happen if i execute that command??Will it restore default settings???
it will delete the folder with the old settings
So for getting new settings what should i do???
it should create them automatically
Oke let me try
you need a valid key from the repos
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver pgp.mit.edu --recv-keys 5044912E
Thankyou :)

Also i am getting this error "W: A error occurred during the signature verification. The repository is not updated and the previous index files will be used. GPG error: http://extras.ubuntu.com maverick Release: The following signatures were invalid: BADSIG 16126D3A3E5C1192 Ubuntu Extras Archive Automatic Signing Key <ftpmaster@ubuntu.com>"
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-extras-keyring
Will installing that solve my problem??
i think so
it would have to download all the files
not possible imho. would be nice though.
